Kyrgyzstan

sourceDesc.p: Researched and written by Chris Morrison, February 2009

div.head: Summary
div.p: The United States recognized Kyrgyzstan’s independence on December 25, 1991, when President George H.W. Bush announced the decision in an address to the nation regarding the dissolution of the Soviet Union.

div.head: U.S. Recognition of Kyrgyzstan, 1991.
div.p: The United States recognized Kyrgyzstan’s independence on December 25, 1991, when President George H.W. Bush announced the decision in an address to the nation regarding the dissolution of the Soviet Union. Kyrgyzstan previously had been a constituent republic of the USSR.

div.head: Establishment of Diplomatic Relations, 1991.
div.p: Diplomatic relations were established on December 25, 1991, when President George H.W. Bush announced the decision in an address to the nation regarding the dissolution of the Soviet Union.

div.head: Establishment of the American Embassy in Bishkek, 2004.
div.p: The American Embassy in Bishkek was established on February 1, 1992, with Edmund McWilliams as Chargé d’Affaires ad interim.
